data.md:MetaData: Detailed description, geochemistry and radioactivity of manganese nodules taken during the R/V Vityaz cruise to the Indian Ocean
Bacteriogenic formation of iron-manganese concretions in the Indian Ocean

During the 33th voyage of the R/V "Vityaz" in the Indian Ocean iron-manganese nodules were collected at several stations. Both nodules and associated sediments were analysed by spectral analysis over 30 chemical elements. Radioactivity measurements were also performed on these samples.

Sample ID | Position | Deposit type | Quantity of deposit | Quantity | Size | Substrate type | Substrate | Sediment type | Sediment | Comment | Description | Beryllium | Be | Spectral analysis | Lead | Pb | Gallium | Ga | Molybdenum | Mo | Copper | Cu | Nickel | Ni | Cobalt | Co | Zirconium | Zr | Vanadium | V | Aluminium | Al | Zinc | Zn | Titanium | Ti | Strontium | Sr | Barium | Ba | Calcium | Ca | Magnesium | Mg | Sodium | Na | Thallium | Tl | Bismuth | Bi | Chromium | Cr | Niobium | Nb | Tin | Sn | Radioactivity [cpm/100g] | Detector raw counts | Counts | Manganese | Mn | Iron | Fe
